results.title: Still in one piece anyway
results.creator_credit: Bruce Mackay, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Takaoka Maru, an enormous super-tanker carrying 1.5 million barrels of oil, as it ponderously winds its way through the Canso Strait to the oil refinery at Chedabucto Bay. It captures the intricate drama of docking and unloading the amount of oil Canada consumes in one day. Through an artful mixture of special sound effects, expressive photography, music and commentary, the film speaks both in awe, and in fear, of this creature of man’s making. A powerful documentary of a most unusual sort. Photographed by Les Krizsan and Barry Perles. Edited by Jy Chiperzak and Bruce Mackay. Sound by Raymond Marcoux and Bernie Bordeleau
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Mackay, Ian McLaren, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Stigma
results.creator_credit: Stanley Jackson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a young woman who suffers a mental breakdown, recovers fully in a mental hospital and returns home. Instead of the understanding and support she most needs from her friends and associates, she is virtually ostracized. The film makes a plea for a change in the sort of public thinking that places a stigma upon people who have suffered from an illness of the mind rather than of the body. Cast includes Martha Choquette, Mickey Martin, Stanley Mellough, Marie-Louisa Holtz, Monique Chabot, Benoit Gerard.

results.title: Steve and Kathy
results.creator_credit: Robert J McCarty and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: Investigates the problems of “going steady” through a dramatisation of the relationship of Steve and Kathy. After going together for some time they decide to break it off. The film discusses how this is best done.

results.title: Steel and atomic energy
results.brief_description: The story of the part played by the steel industry in the British atomic energy power program. Shows the construction of three new production plants at Springfields, Capenhurst and Windscale. This use of atomic energy is only a beginning - its increasing use for other peaceful purposes will have beneficial and far-reaching effects on the future of mankind.

results.title: Station master
results.creator_credit: William Davidson, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Finch, Ontario, is where the Canadian Pacific railway crosses the New York Central, a tiny but important link in Canada’s railway network. This film looks at the daily duties of station master Dalton Henry and his staff.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Davidson, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Station 10
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a factual account of the life of policemen at one station in Montreal, drawn from sixty days and nights of on-the-spot filming. It is a view of life in the inner city that usually only the policeman has reason to encounter. There are ugly incidents here, but there is also reassurance that people in trouble do have help at hand, and that even for the law breaker the policeman does his work with impartiality, and usually with understanding and good humour. (Awards: Montreal; Melbourne.)

results.title: Stars and stripes
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment in film animation in which “stars” and “stripes” perform acrobatics to the tune of the John Philip Sousa’s march. Rippling stripes and gay sparkling stars jump and undulate, dash about the screen, and break into effects suggesting a fireworks display. Sometimes part of a stripe pursues a star. Finally the stars become flashing meteors and burst in light and colour. The film was made without a camera, by Norman McLaren drawing and colouring directly on film.

results.title: Stamina
results.brief_description: A film illustrating the manufacture of Stamina trousers and showing the care exercised in all stages. The various processes are shown together with a brief history of men’s dress and the sewing machine.

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.
results.description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.
